snippet: The reports increased 8 percent in the fiscal year ending September 2014, but some suggested that the rise reflected victims’ increased willingness to file complaints.
abstract: Pentagon study says reports of rapes and sexual assaults in military rose 8 percent in fiscal year ending September 2014; more than 5,400 assaults were reported, compared with about 5,000 in 2013.
lead_paragraph: The reports increased 8 percent in the fiscal year ending September 2014, but some suggested that the rise reflected victims’ increased willingness to file complaints.

headline.main: Reports of Sexual Assaults in Military on Rise
headline.print_headline: Reports of Sexual Assaults in Military on Rise

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
